title: Phase spider
data:
The **phase spider** is a monster that appears in some [variants](/wiki/Variant "Variant").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Origin](#Origin)
- [2 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [2.1 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)
- [3 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [3.1 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry_2)

## Origin

Phase spiders are borrowed from *[Dungeons & Dragons](/wiki/Dungeons_%26_Dragons "Dungeons & Dragons")*.

The *D\&D* incarnation resembles a large white spider with dark green patterns, and a humanoid head with two eyes. It's an ambush predator, phasing from a parallel dimension to surprise its prey, hence the name.

| A phase spider:* has no hands.
* is an [animal](/wiki/Animal "Animal").
* can [lay eggs](/wiki/Oviparous "Oviparous").
* can [teleport](/wiki/Teleport "Teleport").
* is [poisonous](/wiki/Poisonous "Poisonous") to eat.
* is [carnivorous](/wiki/Carnivore "Carnivore").
* is normally generated [hostile](/wiki/Hostile "Hostile").
* is [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong"). |                                                                                                                  |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |                                                                                                                  |
| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             | [SLASH'EM\_0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line1568](/wiki/SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line1568 "SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/monst.c") |

### Encyclopedia entry

Phase potion, which is related to oil of etherealness, is more useful for general combat. When imbibed, this potion allows the user to shift in and out of phase with the Prime Material plane at will, much like a phase spider. When out of phase, the user is impervious to all forms of attack except those that reach into Ethereal plane. ... Phase potions are brewed from phase-spider ichor or from the concentrated juices of rare underground fungi.  
\[ RPG Sheets by Amalor Mymnyx ]  
  
Phase Spiders are not true Spiders, but an alien race which appear as giant spiders with humanoid shaped heads. Phase Spiders speak a whispery language which is reminiscent of the sound of the wind blowing through the trees. ... Phase Spiders are considered Enlightened creatures as they have the ability to phase in and out of our normal space-time into what most scientists would refer to as Void-Space. Phase Spiders use this ability to their great advantage in combat.  
\[ Alien Update Lexicon by Randy Walker ]

- *This page is a **[stub](/wiki/Category:Stubs "Category:Stubs")**. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by [**expanding this page**.](https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Phase_spider\&action=edit)*

| A phase spider:* can [phase](/wiki/Phase "Phase") through walls.
* can [hide under items](/wiki/Hiding "Hiding").
* is an [animal](/wiki/Animal "Animal").
* can [lay eggs](/wiki/Oviparous "Oviparous").
* can [teleport](/wiki/Teleport "Teleport").
* has [teleport control](/wiki/Teleport_control "Teleport control").
* is [carnivorous](/wiki/Carnivore "Carnivore").
* is normally generated [hostile](/wiki/Hostile "Hostile").
* wants the [Amulet of Yendor](/wiki/Amulet_of_Yendor "Amulet of Yendor").
* wants the [Bell of Opening](/wiki/Bell_of_Opening "Bell of Opening").
* wants the [Amulet of Yendor](/wiki/Amulet_of_Yendor "Amulet of Yendor"), the [Bell of Opening](/wiki/Bell_of_Opening "Bell of Opening"), the [Book of the Dead](/wiki/Book_of_the_Dead "Book of the Dead"), the [Candelabrum of Invocation](/wiki/Candelabrum_of_Invocation "Candelabrum of Invocation"), and your [quest artifact](/wiki/Quest_artifact "Quest artifact").
* normally appears in small [groups](/wiki/Group "Group"). |                                                                                                                                                                                    |

Phase spiders favor hit-and-run attacks, biting you and then teleporting away to prevent retaliation. This tactic is of questionable use against [poison resistant](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance") characters, however. Their attack can teleport you, subject to [teleport control](/wiki/Teleport_control "Teleport control").

In addition to being able to teleport, phase spiders in dNetHack can [phase](/wiki/Phase "Phase") through walls.

### Encyclopedia entry

Sometimes confused with neogi or driders and called planar spiders on some worlds of the Prime, phase spiders are intelligent web-spinners with a raised thorax and a humanlike head. What really makes phase spiders stand out is their enviable ability to phase back and forth between a plane and the plane's Border.  
  
Unknown to most creatures, phase spiders possess large web habitats on the Ethereal (both in the Deep and on the Border) and only appear on other planes while hunting for food. Some phase spiders do live mostly on material planes, but these spiders are the exception, not the rule. Like many more familiar cultures, Ethereally-based phase spiders are not a cohesive race, but instead exist in separate clutches (tribes), each of which claims various Prime territories as its sole hunting ground. Sometimes disparate phase spider clutches cooperate, but sometimes they come into conflict over temtorial disputes.

\[ A Guide to the Ethereal Plane, by Bruce R. Cordell ]

[![This article may require revision for the next version of SLASH'EM. Click here for more information.](/images/3/38/Se7e7-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article may require revision for the next version of SLASH'EM. Click here for more information.")

html:
Phase spider

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

The phase spider is a monster that appears in some variants.

Contents

  • 1 Origin
  • 2 SLASH'EM
    • 2.1 Encyclopedia entry
  • 3 dNetHack
    • 3.1 Encyclopedia entry

Origin

Phase spiders are borrowed from Dungeons & Dragons.

The D&D incarnation resembles a large white spider with dark green patterns, and a humanoid head with two eyes. It's an ambush predator, phasing from a parallel dimension to surprise its prey, hence the name.

SLASH'EM

s phase spider
Difficulty 10
Attacks Bite 3d4 poison
s phase spider
Difficulty 10
Attacks

Bite 3d4 poison

Base level 8
Base experience 126
Speed 12
Base AC 2
Base MR 0
Alignment −4 (chaotic)
Frequency (by normal means) 1 (Very rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 100
Nutritional value 100
Size Large
Resistances poison
Resistances conveyed poison (27%), causes teleportitis (40%)

A phase spider:

  • has no hands.
  • is an animal.
  • can lay eggs.
  • can teleport.
  • is poisonous to eat.
  • is carnivorous.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • is strong.
Reference SLASH'EM_0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line1568

Encyclopedia entry

Phase potion, which is related to oil of etherealness, is more useful for general combat. When imbibed, this potion allows the user to shift in and out of phase with the Prime Material plane at will, much like a phase spider. When out of phase, the user is impervious to all forms of attack except those that reach into Ethereal plane. ... Phase potions are brewed from phase-spider ichor or from the concentrated juices of rare underground fungi.
[ RPG Sheets by Amalor Mymnyx ]

Phase Spiders are not true Spiders, but an alien race which appear as giant spiders with humanoid shaped heads. Phase Spiders speak a whispery language which is reminiscent of the sound of the wind blowing through the trees. ... Phase Spiders are considered Enlightened creatures as they have the ability to phase in and out of our normal space-time into what most scientists would refer to as Void-Space. Phase Spiders use this ability to their great advantage in combat.
[ Alien Update Lexicon by Randy Walker ]

This page is a stub. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by expanding this page.

dNetHack

s phase spider
Difficulty 13
Attacks Bite 2d8 poison (dexterity), Claw 2d4 teleportation, Claw 2d4 teleport away
s phase spider
Difficulty 13
Attacks

Bite 2d8 poison (dexterity), Claw 2d4 teleportation, Claw 2d4 teleport away

Base level 8
Base experience 133
Speed 12
Base AC −3
Base MR 0
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 2 (Quite rare)
Genocidable No
Weight 50
Nutritional value 50
Size small
Resistances poison
Resistances conveyed poison

A phase spider:

  • can phase through walls.
  • can hide under items.
  • is an animal.
  • can lay eggs.
  • can teleport.
  • has teleport control.
  • is carnivorous.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • wants the Amulet of Yendor.
  • wants the Bell of Opening.
  • wants the Amulet of Yendor, the Bell of Opening, the Book of the Dead, the Candelabrum of Invocation, and your quest artifact.
  • normally appears in small groups.

Phase spiders favor hit-and-run attacks, biting you and then teleporting away to prevent retaliation. This tactic is of questionable use against poison resistant characters, however. Their attack can teleport you, subject to teleport control.

In addition to being able to teleport, phase spiders in dNetHack can phase through walls.

Encyclopedia entry

Sometimes confused with neogi or driders and called planar spiders on some worlds of the Prime, phase spiders are intelligent web-spinners with a raised thorax and a humanlike head. What really makes phase spiders stand out is their enviable ability to phase back and forth between a plane and the plane's Border.

Unknown to most creatures, phase spiders possess large web habitats on the Ethereal (both in the Deep and on the Border) and only appear on other planes while hunting for food. Some phase spiders do live mostly on material planes, but these spiders are the exception, not the rule. Like many more familiar cultures, Ethereally-based phase spiders are not a cohesive race, but instead exist in separate clutches (tribes), each of which claims various Prime territories as its sole hunting ground. Sometimes disparate phase spider clutches cooperate, but sometimes they come into conflict over temtorial disputes.

[ A Guide to the Ethereal Plane, by Bruce R. Cordell ]

The '''phase spider''' is a monster that appears in some [[variant]]s.

==Origin==
Phase spiders are borrowed from ''[[Dungeons & Dragons]]''.

The ''D&D'' incarnation resembles a large white spider with dark green patterns, and a humanoid head with two eyes. It's an ambush predator, phasing from a parallel dimension to surprise its prey, hence the name.
